eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.overlays

Class ItemizedOverlayWithBubble<Item extends OverlayItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.Overlay
      • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.SafeDrawOverlay
        • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.ItemizedOverlay<Item>
          • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.ItemizedIconOverlay<Item>
            • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.overlays.ItemizedOverlayWithBubble<Item>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Overlay.Snappable, OverlayConstants

    public class ItemizedOverlayWithBubble<Item extends OverlayItem>
extends ItemizedIconOverlay<Item>
    An itemized overlay with an InfoWindow or "bubble" which opens when the user taps on an overlay item, and displays item attributes.
    Items must be ExtendedOverlayItem.
    Author:
    M.Kergall
    See Also:
    ExtendedOverlayItem, InfoWindow

      • showBubbleOnItem

        public void showBubbleOnItem(ExtendedOverlayItem eItem,
                    MapView mapView,
                    boolean panIntoView)

      • showBubbleOnItem

        public void showBubbleOnItem(int index,
                    MapView mapView,
                    boolean panIntoView)
        Opens the bubble on the item. For each ItemizedOverlay, only one bubble is opened at a time. If you want more bubbles opened simultaneously, use many ItemizedOverlays.
        Parameters:
        index - of the overlay item to show
        mapView -
        panIntoView - true if you want the map view to be centered on it.

      • hideBubble

        public void hideBubble()
        Close the bubble (if it's opened).

      • getBubbledItem

        public OverlayItem getBubbledItem()
        Returns:
        the item currently showing the bubble, or null if none.

      • getBubbledItemId

        public int getBubbledItemId()
        Returns:
        the index of the item currently showing the bubble, or -1 if none.

      • draw

        public void draw(ISafeCanvas canvas,
        MapView mapView,
        boolean shadow)
        Description copied from class: Overlay
        Draw the overlay over the map. This will be called on all active overlays with shadow=true, to lay down the shadow layer, and then again on all overlays with shadow=false. Callers should check isEnabled() before calling draw(). By default, draws nothing.
